column3: PS Currently I only turn the RPC calls "getgenerate" and "setgenerate" into no-ops, should they maybe be removed instead?\n

There was a large discussion some time ago about this, split between people wanting to remove all mining code, and people who wanted to keep as much as possible. Eventually a middle ground was chosen: remove the SSE-optimized and assembly code, but keep a simple miner as reference. Maybe this should be reconsidered, but i suppose it will require some discussion first. I'm in favor of removing myse

If a reference implementation is the goal then IMO it should be implemented as a seperate program using the RPC "getwork" interface.

I would argue that Jeff Garzik's RPC CPU miner (the one I mentioned before) is good enough to serve as a reference implementation. Heck the code's a lot cleaner than what's currently inside bitcoin itself.

Furthermore a _good_ reference implementation would IMO
+1 for removing the built-in miner, there are a couple of example implementations in the wild already.\n

I'd be ok with a version of this patch that completely removes the mining code but adds a reference miner (in contrib/ ).  Either Jeff's or a pure-Python-no-dependencies one.

Also:  setgenerate's help text should be changed like you changed getgenerate and both methods should be marked deprecated.

I properly marked both RPC functions as deprecated in their help text.\n\nAs for adding a reference miner, I don't think adding Jeff's to this repo is the way to go, at the most it should be moved to the github 'bitcoin' project. That being said, I can probably whip up a pessimistic (i.e. no single readability compromise for performance) Python miner for contrib/ (probably by the end of next week)

"PS Currently I only turn the RPC calls "getgenerate" and "setgenerate" into no-ops, should they maybe be removed instead?"

+1 to them being removed - and +1 for NOT including a reference miner.
A reference python miner has long existed: https://github.com/jgarzik/pyminer\n
I went ahead and added my python miner to bitcoin/contrib/pyminer/\n

IMO, let's go ahead and remove the *generate RPCs.

Rationale:
- I doubt this will create serious breakage
- Anybody who mines does not use this anyway
- It occasionally creates confusion for newbie pool server operators ("setgenerate is false, does that mean getwork is turned off?")
I agree, no-ops just confuse everyone.\nAlso, is there anyone left who is actually against removing all of this?\n
I would personally -prefer- that the Satoshi Reference Miner remain, but if everyone else wants to remove it, it sounds like I'm outvoted...\n
you can still get the satoshi reference miner - its in git history ;)\n
I've rebased the branch against master to make it easy to merge in.\n

This would also mean that we can get rid of some ugly platform-specific functions in util.h/cpp which will be no longer used:
- SetThreadPriority
- AffinityBugWorkaround

And some general functions only used by the miner:
- alignup
I use the built-in miner quite a lot to test with testnet-in-a-box. I think we should leave it in for now.\n

I still disagree with leaving it in, you can just as easily mine with cpuminer on testnet-in-a-box (in fact, it would be faster) and the codebase is just generally such a mess, removing unused and unnecessary features like satoshi miner should happen ASAP.\n
